segment.source: This topic assumes that you have a background task class written for your app, and that this task needs to run in response to an event triggered by the system such as the internet becoming available or the user logging in.
segment.target: This topic assumes that you have a background task class written for your app, and that this task needs to run in response to an event triggered by the system such as the internet becoming available or the user logging in.

segment.source: This topic focuses on the SystemTrigger class.
segment.target: This topic focuses on the SystemTrigger class.

segment.source: More information on writing a background task class is available in Create and register a background task.
segment.target: More information on writing a background task class is available in Create and register a background task.

segment.source: The first parameter, triggerType, specifies the type of system event trigger that will activate this background task.
segment.target: The first parameter, triggerType, specifies the type of system event trigger that will activate this background task.

segment.source: For a list of event types, see SystemTriggerType.
segment.target: For a list of event types, see SystemTriggerType.

segment.source: The second parameter, OneShot, specifies whether the background task will run once the next time the system event occurs and triggers background tasks; or, every time the system event occurs, until the task is unregistered.
segment.target: The second parameter, OneShot, specifies whether the background task will run once the next time the system event occurs and triggers background tasks; or, every time the system event occurs, until the task is unregistered.

segment.source: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call RemoveAccess and then call RequestAccessAsync when your app launches after being updated.

segment.target: Note Background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.

segment.source: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.
segment.target: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.

segment.source: Ensure that your app gracefully handles scenarios where background task registration fails - if instead your app depends on having a valid registration object after attempting to register a task, it may crash.

segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: To see background task registration in action, download the background task sample.
segment.target: To see background task registration in action, download the background task sample.

segment.source: Background tasks can run in response to SystemTrigger and MaintenanceTrigger events, but you still need to Declare background tasks in the application manifest.
segment.target: Background tasks can run in response to SystemTrigger and MaintenanceTrigger events, but you still need to Declare background tasks in the application manifest.

segment.source: You must also call RequestAccessAsync before registering any background task type.
segment.target: You must also call RequestAccessAsync before registering any background task type.

segment.source: Apps can register background tasks that respond to TimeTrigger, PushNotificationTrigger, and NetworkOperatorNotificationTrigger events, enabling them to provide real-time communication with the user even when the app is not in the foreground.
segment.target: Apps can register background tasks that respond to TimeTrigger, PushNotificationTrigger, and NetworkOperatorNotificationTrigger events, enabling them to provide real-time communication with the user even when the app is not in the foreground.
